snippet: Despite the gains made in curbing AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, there is still a big gap between what’s been accomplished and what more could be done.
abstract: Editorial warns there is still a big gap between what has been accomplished in combating AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, despite enormous gains that have been made in the past decade; laments that global financing for prevention and treatment has fallen short.
lead_paragraph: Despite the gains made in curbing AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, there is still a big gap between what’s been accomplished and what more could be done.
